title: conferred on me by subsection (4)(b) of section 38 of the Data Protection Act
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Data Protection Act 2018 (Section
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Data Protection Act 2018 (Section 

38(4)(b)) (Defence Forces Tribunal of Inquiry) Regulations 2024. 

Definitions
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited data protection act 2018 (section 38(4)(b)) (defence force tribunal inquiry) regulation 2024 definition

title: conferred on me by subsection (4)(b) of section 38 of the Data Protection Act
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“Instrument of 2024” means the Tribunals of Inquiry (Evidence) Act 1921 
(Appointment of Tribunal) Instrument 2024 (S.I. No. 304 of 2024); 

“relevant task”, in relation to the Tribunal, means a task carried out by the 
Tribunal in connection with a matter which is specified in the resolutions as a 
matter of urgent public importance and for which the Tribunal was appointed to 
inquire into, report and make such findings and recommendations as it sees fit 
to the Taoiseach under the Instrument of 2024; 

“resolutions” means the resolution passed by Dáil Éireann on 24 January 2024 
and the resolution passed by Seanad Éireann on 30 January 2024, the text of 
which resolutions is set out in the recital to the Instrument of 2024; 

“Tribunal” means the tribunal appointed by the Instrument of 2024. 

Application of Regulations

title: conferred on me by subsection (4)(b) of section 38 of the Data Protection Act
heading: 3. These Regulations apply to personal data processed by the Tribunal in
text_raw:
3. These Regulations apply to personal data processed by the Tribunal in 

respect of which the Tribunal is the controller. 

Processing, including further processing – public interest
text_norm: 3 regulation apply personal data processed tribunal respect tribunal controller processing including processing - public interest

title: conferred on me by subsection (4)(b) of section 38 of the Data Protection Act
heading: 4. Subject to the Data Protection Regulation and the Data Protection Act
text_raw:
4. Subject to the Data Protection Regulation and the Data Protection Act 
2018 (No. 7 of 2018), the processing, including further processing, by the 
Tribunal of personal data to which these Regulations apply which is necessary 
and proportionate for the performance of a relevant task carried out in the public 
interest by the Tribunal, is hereby specified. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 12th November, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [624] 3 

Circumstances in which personal data may be processed, including further 
processed

title: conferred on me by subsection (4)(b) of section 38 of the Data Protection Act
heading: 5. Without prejudice to the generality of Regulation 4, the circumstances in
text_raw:
5. Without prejudice to the generality of Regulation 4, the circumstances in 
which personal data to which these Regulations apply may be processed, 
including further processed, shall include the performance by the Tribunal of 
such relevant tasks as the Tribunal considers necessary and proportionate to 
enable the Tribunal to perform its functions under the Tribunals of Inquiry 
(Evidence) Acts 1921 to 2011. 

Persons to whom personal data may be disclosed
text_norm: 5 without prejudice generality regulation 4 circumstance personal data regulation apply may processed including processed shall include performance tribunal relevant task tribunal considers necessary proportionate enable tribunal perform function tribunal inquiry (evidence) act 1921 2011 person personal data may disclosed

title: conferred on me by subsection (4)(b) of section 38 of the Data Protection Act
heading: 6. Personal data to which these Regulations apply may be disclosed to the
text_raw:
6. Personal data to which these Regulations apply may be disclosed to the 
following persons in accordance with such policies and procedures as may be 
provided for under Regulation 7: 

(a) 

the sole member of the Tribunal; 

(b) 

the registrar to the Tribunal; 

(c) 

counsel to the Tribunal; 

(d) 

solicitor to the Tribunal; 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

a person appointed by the Tribunal in accordance with section 6 
of the Tribunals of Inquiry (Evidence) (Amendment) Act 2002 
(No. 7 of 2002) to be an investigator; 

a member of staff of the Tribunal; 

a person appointed by the Tribunal to provide advice or assistance 
to it in respect of any matter it thinks fit. 

Conditions of processing, including further processing
text_norm: 6 personal data regulation apply may disclosed following person accordance policy procedure may provided regulation 7 (a) sole member tribunal (b) registrar tribunal (c) counsel tribunal (d) solicitor tribunal (e) (f) (g) person appointed tribunal accordance section 6 tribunal inquiry (evidence) (amendment) act 2002 (no 7 2002) investigator member staff tribunal person appointed tribunal provide advice assistance respect matter think fit condition processing including processing

title: conferred on me by subsection (4)(b) of section 38 of the Data Protection Act
heading: 7. (1) The Tribunal shall prepare and implement policies and procedures for
text_raw:
7. (1) The Tribunal shall prepare and implement policies and procedures for 
the processing, including further processing, of personal data under these 
Regulations. 

(2) Without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (1), the policies and 

procedures referred to in that paragraph shall provide for the following: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

the use of secure storage, passwords, encryption and other 
methods to ensure that personal data can only be accessed by 
persons authorised by the Tribunal to access that personal data; 

the use of controls to ensure that personal data are only disclosed 
to persons authorised by the Tribunal, or who are entitled or 
permitted by law, to receive that personal data; 

the determination of appropriate storage periods for personal data 
or classes of personal data; 

the treatment of personal data or classes of personal data at the 
expiry of the storage periods referred to in subparagraph (c); 

 
 
 
 
 4 [624] 

(e) 

data minimisation, including the use of anonymisation and 
pseudonymisation, where appropriate. 

(3) The policies and procedures referred to in paragraph (1) shall be 
reviewed by the Tribunal on a regular basis and, as the Tribunal considers it 
appropriate to do so, be updated. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

7 November, 2024. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 
Minister for Defence. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [624] 5

title: conferred on me by subsection (4)(b) of section 38 of the Data Protection Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations authorise the processing, including the further processing, of 
personal data by the Defence Forces Tribunal of Inquiry (‘the Tribunal’) 
pursuant to section 38 (4) of the Data Protection Act 2018 to the extent that such 
processing is necessary and proportionate to the performance of a relevant task 
by the Tribunal. 

The Regulations also require the Tribunal to have in place certain policies and 
procedures relating to the processing, including the further processing, of data 
under these regulations. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [624]
